title: [BUG] ForecastingHorizon equality for pandas PeriodIndex
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
When checking for equality for two identical `sktime.forecasting.base.ForecastingHorizon` where the values are `pandas.PeriodIndex` the output is an `numpy.ndarray` where all the elements are False.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from copy import deepcopy
from sktime.forecasting.base import ForecastingHorizon
from pandas import PeriodIndex

period_index = PeriodIndex(['2020-08', '2020-09', '2020-10'], freq='M')

# Relative
fh_relative_1 = ForecastingHorizon(values=[1,2,3], is_relative=True)
fh_relative_2 = ForecastingHorizon(values=[1,2,3], is_relative=True)
print(fh_relative_1 == fh_relative_2)
# output: [ True  True  True]

# Absolute
fh_absolute_1 = ForecastingHorizon(values=deepcopy(period_index), is_relative=False)
fh_absolute_2 = ForecastingHorizon(values=deepcopy(period_index), is_relative=False)
fh_absolute_3 = deepcopy(fh_absolute_2)

print(fh_absolute_1 == fh_absolute_2)
# output: [False False False]
print(fh_absolute_2 == fh_absolute_3)
# output: [False False False]
print(fh_absolute_1._values == fh_absolute_2._values)
# output: [ True  True  True]
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The output should be a `numpy.ndarray` where all elements are `True `.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
Identified this when writing the tests for #2197.
